actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

official_title: A bill to amend title 15, United States Code, to authorize the Consumer Product Safety Commission to regulate the risk of injury associated with firearms.

summary.text: Gun Safety Act of 1991 - Repeals provisions of the Consumer Product Safety Act which exclude pistols, revolvers, other firearms, shells, and cartridges from the definition of "consumer product." Excludes firearms from provisions allowing the Consumer Product Safety Commission to declare a product a banned hazardous product. Amends the Consumer Product Safety Commission Improvements Act of 1976 to repeal provisions prohibiting the Commission from making a ruling or order that restricts the manufacture or sale of firearms, ammunition, or ammunition components.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 15, United States Code, to authorize the Consumer Product Safety Commission to regulate the risk of injury associated with firearms.
